ece/line_of_sight.documentation: Line of sight of the diagnostic (fill when valid for all channels), defined by two points. By convention, the first point is the closest to the diagnostic. In case the channels have different lines of sight, they should be described within the channel array of structures. Within ece IDS: Electron cyclotron emission diagnostic.

ece/t_radiation_central.documentation: Radiation temperature from the closest channel to the magnetic axis, together with its radial location. Within ece IDS: Electron cyclotron emission diagnostic.

ece/t_radiation_central/data.documentation: Data. Within ece IDS: Electron cyclotron emission diagnostic. Within t_radiation_central container: Radiation temperature from the closest channel to the magnetic axis, together with its radial location.

ece/t_radiation_central/rho_tor_norm.documentation: Normalized toroidal flux coordinate of the measurement. Within ece IDS: Electron cyclotron emission diagnostic. Within t_radiation_central container: Radiation temperature from the closest channel to the magnetic axis, together with its radial location.

ece/t_radiation_central/validity_timed.documentation: Indicator of the validity of the data for each time slice. 0: valid from automated processing, 1: valid and certified by the diagnostic RO; - 1 means problem identified in the data processing (request verification by the diagnostic RO), -2: invalid data, should not be used (values lower than -2 have a code-specific meaning detailing the origin of their invalidity). Within ece IDS: Electron cyclotron emission diagnostic. Within t_radiation_central container: Radiation temperature from the closest channel to the magnetic axis, together with its radial location.

ece/t_radiation_central/validity.documentation: Indicator of the validity of the data for the whole acquisition period. 0: valid from automated processing, 1: valid and certified by the diagnostic RO; - 1 means problem identified in the data processing (request verification by the diagnostic RO), -2: invalid data, should not be used (values lower than -2 have a code-specific meaning detailing the origin of their invalidity). Within ece IDS: Electron cyclotron emission diagnostic. Within t_radiation_central container: Radiation temperature from the closest channel to the magnetic axis, together with its radial location.

ece/t_radiation_central/time.documentation: Time. Within ece IDS: Electron cyclotron emission diagnostic. Within t_radiation_central container: Radiation temperature from the closest channel to the magnetic axis, together with its radial location.

ece/t_radiation_central_x.documentation: Predicted radiation temperature of the channel closest to the magnetic axis, together with its radial location (eXtraordinary mode). Within ece IDS: Electron cyclotron emission diagnostic.

ece/channel.documentation: Set of channels (frequency). Within ece IDS: Electron cyclotron emission diagnostic.

ece/channel/name.documentation: Short string identifier (unique for a given device). Within ece IDS: Electron cyclotron emission diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (frequency).

ece/channel/description.documentation: Description, e.g. “channel viewing the upper divertor”. Within ece IDS: Electron cyclotron emission diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (frequency).

ece/channel/frequency.documentation: Frequency of the channel. Within ece IDS: Electron cyclotron emission diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (frequency).

Within ece IDS: Electron cyclotron emission diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (frequency). Within frequency container: Frequency of the channel.

ece/channel/harmonic.documentation: Harmonic detected by the channel. 1 corresponds to the "O1" mode, while 2 corresponds to the "X2" mode. Within ece IDS: Electron cyclotron emission diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (frequency).

Fill only in case the channels have different lines of sight. Within ece IDS: Electron cyclotron emission diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (frequency).

ece/channel/position/theta.documentation: Poloidal angle (oriented clockwise when viewing the poloidal cross section on the right hand side of the tokamak axis of symmetry, with the origin placed on the plasma magnetic axis). Within ece IDS: Electron cyclotron emission diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (frequency). Within position container: Position of the measurements (taking into account the suprathermal shift).

ece/channel/delta_position_suprathermal.documentation: Simple estimate of the difference in position induced by the presence of suprathermal electrons. ece/channel/optical_depth.documentation: Optical depth of the plasma at the position of the measurement. This parameter is a proxy for the local / non-local character of the ECE emission. It must be greater than 1 to guarantee that the measurement is dominated by local ECE emission (non-local otherwise). Within ece IDS: Electron cyclotron emission diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (frequency).

ece/channel/optical_depth/data.documentation: Data. Within ece IDS: Electron cyclotron emission diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (frequency). Within optical_depth container: Optical depth of the plasma at the position of the measurement. This parameter is a proxy for the local / non-local character of the ECE emission. It must be greater than 1 to guarantee that the measurement is dominated by local ECE emission (non-local otherwise).

ece/channel/optical_depth/validity_timed.documentation: Indicator of the validity of the data for each time slice. 0: valid from automated processing, 1: valid and certified by the diagnostic RO; - 1 means problem identified in the data processing (request verification by the diagnostic RO), -2: invalid data, should not be used (values lower than -2 have a code-specific meaning detailing the origin of their invalidity). It must be greater than 1 to guarantee that the measurement is dominated by local ECE emission (non-local otherwise).

Within optical_depth container: Optical depth of the plasma at the position of the measurement. This parameter is a proxy for the local / non-local character of the ECE emission. ece/channel/time.documentation: Timebase for the processed dynamic data of this channel (outside of the beam and calibration_offset structures). Within ece IDS: Electron cyclotron emission diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (frequency).

ece/channel/calibration_factor.documentation: Calibration factor, used as t_radiation = calibration_factor * (voltage_t_radiation - calibration_offset). Within ece IDS: Electron cyclotron emission diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (frequency).

ece/channel/calibration_offset.documentation: Calibration offset, may be re-evaluated dynamically during long pulses on some experiments. Within ece IDS: Electron cyclotron emission diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (frequency).

ece/channel/calibration_offset/data.documentation: Data. Within ece IDS: Electron cyclotron emission diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (frequency). Within calibration_offset container: Calibration offset, may be re-evaluated dynamically during long pulses on some experiments.

ece/channel/calibration_offset/time.documentation: Time. Within ece IDS: Electron cyclotron emission diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (frequency). Within calibration_offset container: Calibration offset, may be re-evaluated dynamically during long pulses on some experiments.

ece/channel/beam.documentation: ECE Gaussian optics parameters taken at the line_of_sight/first_point position (for synthetic modelling of the ECE emission). Within ece IDS: Electron cyclotron emission diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (frequency).

ece/channel/beam/spot.documentation: Spot ellipse characteristics. Within ece IDS: Electron cyclotron emission diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (frequency). Toroidal wave number, contains a single value if varying_n_phi = 0 to avoid useless repetition of constant values. The wave vector toroidal component is defined as k_phi = n_phi grad phi where phi is the toroidal angle so that a positive n_phi means a wave propagating in the positive phi direction. Within ece IDS: Electron cyclotron emission diagnostic. Within channel container: Set of channels (frequency). Within beam_tracing container: Beam tracing calculations, for various time slices. ece/polarizer.documentation: Set of polarizers placed in front of the diagnostic (if any). Polarizers are assumed to be orthogonal to the line of sight, so that the x3 unit vector is aligned with the line of sight. Within ece IDS: Electron cyclotron emission diagnostic.

ece/polarizer/centre.documentation: If geometry_type=2, coordinates of the centre of the circle. If geometry_type=1 or 3, coordinates of the origin of the local coordinate system (X1,X2,X3) describing the plane polarizer. This origin is located within the polarizer area. Note that there is some flexibility here and the data provider should choose the most convenient coordinate system for the object, respecting the definitions of (X1,X2,X3) indicated below. Within ece IDS: Electron cyclotron emission diagnostic. Within polarizer container: Set of polarizers placed in front of the diagnostic (if any). Polarizers are assumed to be orthogonal to the line of sight, so that the x3 unit vector is aligned with the line of sight.

ece/polarizer/centre/r.documentation: Major radius. Within ece IDS: Electron cyclotron emission diagnostic. Within polarizer container: Set of polarizers placed in front of the diagnostic (if any). Polarizers are assumed to be orthogonal to the line of sight, so that the x3 unit vector is aligned with the line of sight. Within centre container: If geometry_type=2, coordinates of the centre of the circle. If geometry_type=1 or 3, coordinates of the origin of the local coordinate system (X1,X2,X3) describing the plane polarizer. This origin is located within the polarizer area. Note that there is some flexibility here and the data provider should choose the most convenient coordinate system for the object, respecting the definitions of (X1,X2,X3) indicated below.

ece/polarizer/centre/phi.documentation: Toroidal angle (oriented counter-clockwise when viewing from above). Within ece IDS: Electron cyclotron emission diagnostic. Within polarizer container: Set of polarizers placed in front of the diagnostic (if any). Polarizers are assumed to be orthogonal to the line of sight, so that the x3 unit vector is aligned with the line of sight. Within centre container: If geometry_type=2, coordinates of the centre of the circle. ece/polarizer/radius.documentation: Radius of the circle, used only if geometry_type = 2. Within ece IDS: Electron cyclotron emission diagnostic. Within polarizer container: Set of polarizers placed in front of the diagnostic (if any). Polarizers are assumed to be orthogonal to the line of sight, so that the x3 unit vector is aligned with the line of sight.

ece/polarizer/x1_unit_vector.documentation: Components of the X1 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X1 vector is more horizontal than X2 (has a smaller abs(Z) component) and oriented in the positive phi direction (counter-clockwise when viewing from above). Within ece IDS: Electron cyclotron emission diagnostic. Within polarizer container: Set of polarizers placed in front of the diagnostic (if any). Polarizers are assumed to be orthogonal to the line of sight, so that the x3 unit vector is aligned with the line of sight.

ece/polarizer/x1_unit_vector/x.documentation: Component along X axis. Within ece IDS: Electron cyclotron emission diagnostic. Within polarizer container: Set of polarizers placed in front of the diagnostic (if any). Polarizers are assumed to be orthogonal to the line of sight, so that the x3 unit vector is aligned with the line of sight. The X1 vector is more horizontal than X2 (has a smaller abs(Z) component) and oriented in the positive phi direction (counter-clockwise when viewing from above).

The X1 vector is more horizontal than X2 (has a smaller abs(Z) component) and oriented in the positive phi direction (counter-clockwise when viewing from above).

ece/polarizer/x1_unit_vector/z.documentation: Component along Z axis. Within ece IDS: Electron cyclotron emission diagnostic. ece/polarizer/x2_unit_vector.documentation: Components of the X2 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X2 axis is orthonormal so that uX2 = uX3 x uX1. Within ece IDS: Electron cyclotron emission diagnostic. Within polarizer container: Set of polarizers placed in front of the diagnostic (if any). Polarizers are assumed to be orthogonal to the line of sight, so that the x3 unit vector is aligned with the line of sight.

ece/polarizer/x2_unit_vector/x.documentation: Component along X axis. Within ece IDS: Electron cyclotron emission diagnostic. The X2 axis is orthonormal so that uX2 = uX3 x uX1.

ece/polarizer/x2_unit_vector/y.documentation: Component along Y axis. Within ece IDS: Electron cyclotron emission diagnostic. ece/polarizer/x3_unit_vector.documentation: Components of the X3 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. Within x3_unit_vector container: Components of the X3 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X3 axis is normal to the polarizer plane and oriented towards the plasma.

ece/polarizer/x3_unit_vector/y.documentation: Component along Y axis. Within ece IDS: Electron cyclotron emission diagnostic. Within polarizer container: Set of polarizers placed in front of the diagnostic (if any). Polarizers are assumed to be orthogonal to the line of sight, so that the x3 unit vector is aligned with the line of sight. Within x3_unit_vector container: Components of the X3 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X3 axis is normal to the polarizer plane and oriented towards the plasma.

ece/polarizer/x3_unit_vector/z.documentation: Component along Z axis. Within ece IDS: Electron cyclotron emission diagnostic. Within polarizer container: Set of polarizers placed in front of the diagnostic (if any). Polarizers are assumed to be orthogonal to the line of sight, so that the x3 unit vector is aligned with the line of sight. Within x3_unit_vector container: Components of the X3 direction unit vector in the (X,Y,Z) coordinate system, where X is the major radius axis for phi = 0, Y is the major radius axis for phi = pi/2, and Z is the height axis. The X3 axis is normal to the polarizer plane and oriented towards the plasma.

ece/polarizer/polarization_angle.documentation: Alignment angle of the polarizer in the (x1,x2) plane. Electric fields parallel to the polarizer angle will be reflected. The angle is defined with respect to the x1 unit vector, positive in the counter-clockwise direction when looking towards the plasma. Within ece IDS: Electron cyclotron emission diagnostic. Within polarizer container: Set of polarizers placed in front of the diagnostic (if any). Polarizers are assumed to be orthogonal to the line of sight, so that the x3 unit vector is aligned with the line of sight.

ece/psi_normalization.documentation: Quantities to use to normalize psi, as a function of time. Within ece IDS: Electron cyclotron emission diagnostic.

ece/psi_normalization/psi_magnetic_axis.documentation: Value of the poloidal magnetic flux at the magnetic axis. Within ece IDS: Electron cyclotron emission diagnostic. Within psi_normalization container: Quantities to use to normalize psi, as a function of time.

ece/psi_normalization/psi_boundary.documentation: Value of the poloidal magnetic flux at the plasma boundary. Within ece IDS: Electron cyclotron emission diagnostic. Within psi_normalization container: Quantities to use to normalize psi, as a function of time.

ece/psi_normalization/time.documentation: Time for the R,Z,phi coordinates. Within ece IDS: Electron cyclotron emission diagnostic. Within psi_normalization container: Quantities to use to normalize psi, as a function of time.

ece/latency.documentation: Upper bound of the delay between physical information received by the detector and data available on the real-time (RT) network. Within ece IDS: Electron cyclotron emission diagnostic.

ece/time.documentation: Generic time. Within ece IDS: Electron cyclotron emission diagnostic.
